protocol_name: Roseobacter Screening Of Surface Waters For Viruses
protocol_name_html: Roseobacter Screening Of Surface Waters For Viruses
protocol_affiliation: Matthew Sullivan Lab, University of Arizona, Ohio State University

authors_list.name: Matthew Sullivan
authors_list.affiliation: Matthew Sullivan Lab, University of Arizona, Ohio State University

guidelines:
Notes:

Goal initially is to screen several seawater samples on several roseobacter hosts to determine breadth of rosephage present at each location and then to focus on a single site.

Nomenclature for viruses should include a designation for the site of seawater collection followed by a number and the host it was isolated on.

Put information into an Excel worksheet. Create a separate Excel file for each source of virus. Use a different tab in each worksheet for different hosts.

Turbid plaques indicate possible lysogenic phage that may be of interest to Feng Chen’s laboratory in Maryland. Keep the plaque plug at 4°C. Take 50-100 µl from a few and grow up small 1 ml cultures to cryopreserve (glycerol) them. Here trying to get the putative lysogenic cells (prophage containing confers resistance to colonies of cells within the plaque = turbid).

components.data: Pull Roseobacter cultures from freeze and grow in 5 ml broth cultures
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Pull Roseobacter cultures from freeze and grow in 5 ml broth cultures

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 1 of Roseobacter Screening Of Surface Waters For Viruses
source_data.protocol_name: Roseobacter Screening Of Surface Waters For Viruses
source_data.protocol_name_html: Roseobacter Screening Of Surface Waters For Viruses
source_data.annotation: Matt has 14 isolates from Wendy Ye in Mary Ann Moran’s lab in Georgia. Two of them are from open ocean (CCS1 and CCS2) and they are grown at 20-22°C in 1/10 YTSS. All others are from coastal waters and are grown at 30°C in 1/2 YTSS. For virus screening, grow them to log phase (OD<sub>600</sub> = 0.6 - 0.8). Some will grow quickly (overnight) while others will take 1-4 days to reach a log phase.
source_data.thread_text: Matt has 14 isolates from Wendy Ye in Mary Ann Moran’s lab in Georgia. Two of them are from open ocean (CCS1 and CCS2) and they are grown at 20-22°C in 1/10 YTSS. All others are from coastal waters and are grown at 30°C in 1/2 YTSS. For virus screening, grow them to log phase (OD<sub>600</sub> = 0.6 - 0.8). Some will grow quickly (overnight) while others will take 1-4 days to reach a log phase.
source_data.body: Matt has 14 isolates from Wendy Ye in Mary Ann Moran’s lab in Georgia. Two of them are from open ocean (CCS1 and CCS2) and they are grown at 20-22°C in 1/10 YTSS. All others are from coastal waters and are grown at 30°C in 1/2 YTSS. For virus screening, grow them to log phase (OD<sub>600</sub> = 0.6 - 0.8). Some will grow quickly (overnight) while others will take 1-4 days to reach a log phase.

components.data: Perform virus screening in sterile 96 well flat-bottom tissue culture treated microtiter plates
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Perform virus screening in sterile 96 well flat-bottom tissue culture treated microtiter plates

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 2 of Roseobacter Screening Of Surface Waters For Viruses
source_data.protocol_name: Roseobacter Screening Of Surface Waters For Viruses
source_data.protocol_name_html: Roseobacter Screening Of Surface Waters For Viruses
source_data.annotation: Viruses will be screened from seawater collected from various sources.
source_data.thread_text: Viruses will be screened from seawater collected from various sources.
source_data.body: Viruses will be screened from seawater collected from various sources.

source_data.description: Store seawater filtrates at 4°C

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 3 of Roseobacter Screening Of Surface Waters For Viruses
source_data.protocol_name: Roseobacter Screening Of Surface Waters For Viruses
source_data.protocol_name_html: Roseobacter Screening Of Surface Waters For Viruses

components.data: Absorb the viruses to the bacteria
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Absorb the viruses to the bacteria

components.data: Place 15 µl of log phase cells and 15 µl of seawater filtrate (containing virus) into wells of a 96 well plate
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place 15 µl of log phase cells and 15 µl of seawater filtrate (containing virus) into wells of a 96 well plate

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 5 of Roseobacter Screening Of Surface Waters For Viruses
source_data.protocol_name: Roseobacter Screening Of Surface Waters For Viruses
source_data.protocol_name_html: Roseobacter Screening Of Surface Waters For Viruses
source_data.annotation: Uninfected controls should surround infected wells on each plate in a checkerboard pattern.
source_data.thread_text: Uninfected controls should surround infected wells on each plate in a checkerboard pattern.
source_data.body: Uninfected controls should surround infected wells on each plate in a checkerboard pattern.

components.data: Allow the viruses to absorb to the bacteria for 1 hour
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Allow the viruses to absorb to the bacteria for 1 hour

components.data: Add 200 µl growth media (1/2 or 1/10 YTSS) to the wells
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 200 µl growth media (1/2 or 1/10 YTSS) to the wells

components.data: Seal the plate with parafilm and incubate with shaking
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Seal the plate with parafilm and incubate with shaking

components.data: Look for infected wells that show lysis with respect to uninoculated controls
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Look for infected wells that show lysis with respect to uninoculated controls

components.data: Enrich for viruses by transferring from initial 96 well plate to another 96-well plate containing fresh liquid media (“frogging” into new wells)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Enrich for viruses by transferring from initial 96 well plate to another 96-well plate containing fresh liquid media (“frogging” into new wells)

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 10 of Roseobacter Screening Of Surface Waters For Viruses
source_data.protocol_name: Roseobacter Screening Of Surface Waters For Viruses
source_data.protocol_name_html: Roseobacter Screening Of Surface Waters For Viruses
source_data.annotation: Does not require fresh log-phase host cells, the cells come with the transfer. Ideally frog before cells into stationary phase.
source_data.thread_text: Does not require fresh log-phase host cells, the cells come with the transfer. Ideally frog before cells into stationary phase.
source_data.body: Does not require fresh log-phase host cells, the cells come with the transfer. Ideally frog before cells into stationary phase.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 10 of Roseobacter Screening Of Surface Waters For Viruses
source_data.protocol_name: Roseobacter Screening Of Surface Waters For Viruses
source_data.protocol_name_html: Roseobacter Screening Of Surface Waters For Viruses
source_data.annotation: Enrichment for viruses may take several rounds of culturing because we're assuming initial concentrations of phages in the seawater are low.
source_data.thread_text: Enrichment for viruses may take several rounds of culturing because we're assuming initial concentrations of phages in the seawater are low.
source_data.body: Enrichment for viruses may take several rounds of culturing because we're assuming initial concentrations of phages in the seawater are low.

components.data: Once enriched sufficiently, filter out cells with 0.2um filtration into 1.5ml microfuge tubes
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Once enriched sufficiently, filter out cells with 0.2um filtration into 1.5ml microfuge tubes

components.data: Spin for 5 mins. at max to pellet cells
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Spin for 5 mins. at max to pellet cells

components.data: Transfer supernatant to fresh tube for storage
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Transfer supernatant to fresh tube for storage
Store at 4°C

components.data: Plaque-purify wells containing virus by growing cells plus virus on solid media
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Plaque-purify wells containing virus by growing cells plus virus on solid media

components.data: Prepare solid agar media and 0.5% overlay agar
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Prepare solid agar media and 0.5% overlay agar

components.data: Absorb virus to cells using as a starting point, 25 µl virus from 96 well plate enrichments and 200 µl log-phase host bacteria for 1hr
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Absorb virus to cells using as a starting point, 25 µl virus from 96 well plate enrichments and 200 µl log-phase host bacteria for 1hr

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 17 of Roseobacter Screening Of Surface Waters For Viruses
source_data.protocol_name: Roseobacter Screening Of Surface Waters For Viruses
source_data.protocol_name_html: Roseobacter Screening Of Surface Waters For Viruses
source_data.annotation: Try growing lawns first, maybe needs to be up to 1 ml cells.
source_data.thread_text: Try growing lawns first, maybe needs to be up to 1 ml cells.
source_data.body: Try growing lawns first, maybe needs to be up to 1 ml cells.

components.data: Mix the virus-absorbed cells in the 5 ml overlay agar
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Mix the virus-absorbed cells in the 5 ml overlay agar
Pour over the solid media

components.data: Incubate and look for plaque formation
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate and look for plaque formation

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 20 of Roseobacter Screening Of Surface Waters For Viruses
source_data.protocol_name: Roseobacter Screening Of Surface Waters For Viruses
source_data.protocol_name_html: Roseobacter Screening Of Surface Waters For Viruses
source_data.annotation: Will have several possible results: no plaques (not likely if using virus-enriched cultures from 95 well plates), too many plaques to purify them (in which case, a dilution of virus is made and plaque assay repeated), or well-resolved plaques. If well-resolved plaques, then cored from agar using Pasteur pipet and dispensed into 100μl YTSS broth in 1.5ml tubes.
source_data.thread_text: Will have several possible results: no plaques (not likely if using virus-enriched cultures from 95 well plates), too many plaques to purify them (in which case, a dilution of virus is made and plaque assay repeated), or well-resolved plaques. If well-resolved plaques, then cored from agar using Pasteur pipet and dispensed into 100μl YTSS broth in 1.5ml tubes.
source_data.body: Will have several possible results: no plaques (not likely if using virus-enriched cultures from 95 well plates), too many plaques to purify them (in which case, a dilution of virus is made and plaque assay repeated), or well-resolved plaques. If well-resolved plaques, then cored from agar using Pasteur pipet and dispensed into 100μl YTSS broth in 1.5ml tubes.

components.data: Pick representatives of all plaque types present and record appearance of the plaques
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Pick representatives of all plaque types present and record appearance of the plaques

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 21 of Roseobacter Screening Of Surface Waters For Viruses
source_data.protocol_name: Roseobacter Screening Of Surface Waters For Viruses
source_data.protocol_name_html: Roseobacter Screening Of Surface Waters For Viruses
source_data.annotation: Clear, well-lysed plaques are of the most interest to us. Turbid plaques may indicate lysogenic phage and some should be picked, but these will be sent to another laboratory for further study (see guidelines).
source_data.thread_text: Clear, well-lysed plaques are of the most interest to us. Turbid plaques may indicate lysogenic phage and some should be picked, but these will be sent to another laboratory for further study (see guidelines).
source_data.body: Clear, well-lysed plaques are of the most interest to us. Turbid plaques may indicate lysogenic phage and some should be picked, but these will be sent to another laboratory for further study (see guidelines).

components.data: Store the broth that contains the agar plugs at 4°C and allow the viruses to diffuse out of the agar into the broth
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Store the broth that contains the agar plugs at 4°C and allow the viruses to diffuse out of the agar into the broth

components.data: Once the viruses are plaque-purified they can be scaled-up in 5 ml broth cultures for DNA purification
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Once the viruses are plaque-purified they can be scaled-up in 5 ml broth cultures for DNA purification

components.data: Take 25 µl of the plaque-purified virus (agar plug in ~100 µl broth) and absorb to 200 µl log-phase bacteria for 1 hr
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Take 25 µl of the plaque-purified virus (agar plug in ~100 µl broth) and absorb to 200 µl log-phase bacteria for 1 hr

components.data: Add to 5 ml broth and grow with shaking
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add to 5 ml broth and grow with shaking

components.data: Centrifuge out cells and filter culture through 0.2 µm filter
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge out cells and filter culture through 0.2 µm filter

components.data: SYBR stain a portion of the filtrate to determine how much virus is present
components.name: Description

source_data.description: SYBR stain a portion of the filtrate to determine how much virus is present

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 27 of Roseobacter Screening Of Surface Waters For Viruses
source_data.protocol_name: Roseobacter Screening Of Surface Waters For Viruses
source_data.protocol_name_html: Roseobacter Screening Of Surface Waters For Viruses
source_data.annotation: If a lot of virus is present, then may be enough to purify DNA.
source_data.thread_text: If a lot of virus is present, then may be enough to purify DNA.
source_data.body: If a lot of virus is present, then may be enough to purify DNA.

components.data: Purify DNA using the Promega Wizard Lambda DNA kit
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Purify DNA using the Promega Wizard Lambda DNA kit

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 28 of Roseobacter Screening Of Surface Waters For Viruses
source_data.protocol_name: Roseobacter Screening Of Surface Waters For Viruses
source_data.protocol_name_html: Roseobacter Screening Of Surface Waters For Viruses
source_data.annotation: Goal is to obtain about 1 µg DNA for future work. If 5 ml does not yield that amount, will need to grow up more (e.g. 225 ml volume) and repeat DNA purification.
source_data.thread_text: Goal is to obtain about 1 µg DNA for future work. If 5 ml does not yield that amount, will need to grow up more (e.g. 225 ml volume) and repeat DNA purification.
source_data.body: Goal is to obtain about 1 µg DNA for future work. If 5 ml does not yield that amount, will need to grow up more (e.g. 225 ml volume) and repeat DNA purification.
